intro: Drymonia pilifera, commonly known as the silky drymonia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Drymonia pilifera thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps.
